Detailed Description

Class for performing basic database tasks with PDO.

NOTE: Although this uses PDO, a handful of methods in this class will probably only work with MySQL particularly those which retrieve information about tables such as getPrimaryKey, etc. All methods that Insert/ Read/ Update/ Delete data should be pretty database agnostic.

NOTE: At the moment this class has ONLY been tested on MySQL

TO SET NAMES, USE ON THE $opts PARAM OF THE CONSTRUCTOR: array(PDO::MYSQL_ATTR_INIT_COMMAND => 'SET NAMES \'UTF8\'')

string$dbTypetype of database - must be one of the following: mysql, sqlite, pgsql, firebird, informix, oracle, odbc, dblib, ibm
string$hostORpathip or name of host (in the case of mysql or pgsql) or file path to db (in case of sqlite, firebird)
string$portadditional param where you can specify the port

EscapeString (   $string,
  $stripTags = false,
  $paramType = PDO::PARAM_STR 
)

replacement for PDO::quote, this escapes special characters. Also, PDO::quote adds quotes at the beginning and end of strings which is lame and unwanted, so we're not doing that

Parameters
string$stringthe string we're working with
bool$stripTagswhether or not to strip tags from the input string
int$paramTypeparameter type hint to provide to PDO. See http://php.net/manual/en/pdo.constants.php for more
Returns
string

static makeQueryOrLoop (   $field,
  $array 
)
static

Loops through an array of options to build a query with them as " $field='$item1' OR $field='$item2'" etc. This is preferred over the SQL 'IN' syntax mostly because this method can be extended in sub-classes

Parameters
string$field
array$array
Returns
array

MultiQuery (   $array,
  $sleep = false,
  $sleepNum = null,
  $sleepTime = null 
)

submits multiple queries to the database. Primarily used for disparate queries. Inserting multiple values for essentially the same query is the domain of prepared statements. See InsertMultiple for a way to do that

Parameters
array$arraythe array of queries
bool$sleepwhether or not to sleep every so often (to reduce some load)
int$sleepNumhow many iterations to run before sleeping
int$sleepTimehow long to sleep
Returns
bool
MultiQueryTransaction (   $queries)

Like above: submits multiple queries to the database. Primarily used for disparate queries. Inserting multiple values for essentially the same query is the domain of prepared statements. See InsertMultiple for a way to do that This version performs this work as a transaction NOTE: This method will return true, even for MyISAM tables (which do not support transactions)

modify to check whether a transaction is already running first. See: http://www.php.net/manual/en/pdo.begintransaction.php#81022

Parameters
array$queriesthe array of queries
Returns
bool

RawExec (   $query)

Performs a raw PDO::exec() on a query. Really meant for queries that don't return results

Parameters
string$querythe query to be run
Returns
int returns the number of rows that were modified or deleted by the SQL statement you issued. If no rows were affected, returns 0

SelectPrepared (   $table,
  $criteria,
  $fields = '*',
  $limit = null,
  $orderBy = null,
  $orderDir = null 
)

Selects data from database using prepared statements. NOTE: This is the preferred method of retrieving data NOTE: This method does not work with LIKE statements

Parameters
string$tablethe table from which the data will come
array$criteriaarray of key=>val pairs for selection criteria
string$fieldsthe fields to retrieve from the database
int$limitlimit to the # of results to return
string$orderBythe field to order the results by
string$orderDirthe direction to order the results
Returns
array

SQLImport (   $file,
  $sleep = 3 
)

imports a text file of SQL statements into the database IMPORTANT! All SQL statements must be on their own line and CANNOT contain multiple lines DOES NOT check for file existence before proceeding. This is your responsibility

make a version of this which uses transactions

Parameters
string$filethe name/ path of the file to import
int$sleepnumber of seconds to sleep between queries. Necessary when doing a huge import
Returns
string
